Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2009 09:22PM AzKim wrote: Hello Gymgirl,.sorry this happening. I did a little research for her area and all I could find was,.Cancer Detection Programs:Every Woman Counts. They do free screening for women 40 and older,.but,.maybe if you call them and explain her situation,.that she does in fact have a lump,.they may be able to give you/her some options. Here is the phone number 1-800-511-2300 M-F 8:30-5. Here is the website address as well: www.cdph.ca.gov/programs/CancerDetection/Pages/CancerDetectionProgramsEveryWomanCounts.aspx Goodluck. Kim~

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2009 01:01PM AzKim wrote: Hi Michele, as you can see,.I had 28 nodes removed and 25 were positive. My tumor was 8cm and I too had ILC. That was almost 2 years ago,.I've done the AC,.Taxol and rads,..so far,.I'm cancer free. :)  Hang in there and don't give up. There are quite a few ladies on here who have had extensive node involvement and are still here years later! Are you finished with all your chemo? If so,.you won't be bald much longer. It should grow into "fuzz" while doing rads. ' ) ((Hugs)) Kim~

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2009 08:32AM AzKim wrote: Hi flowerpower! Thanks for replying. :) I had surgery (double mast) no reconstruction,.chemo,.rads and Herceptin. I had no problems with the radiation except for blistering near the end of my treatment. It wasn't horrible? But,.it was uncomfortable,.like a bad sunburn. I used the bandage (ace-like bandage) I got from surgery and wrapped that around my chest to hold a non stick gauze pad with cream in place until I healed.  It worked perfect! I still had to tape it into my armpit,.but,.the bandage worked good keeping it in place while I slept and doing activities. Other than that,..no side effects. :)
Posts.Title: Newbie here AzKim cherneski

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2009 07:43AM AzKim wrote: WOO-HOO! 24 hrs is over! I can post again! lol. Thanks to everyone who has said,.hello.  Kim40,.you asked about my mets status,..well,.my path report states I have metastic ILC,.My bone and MRI scan both came back clear,.so,.I don't know why exactly it says that,.unless it's because the cancer spread into so many nodes? (I should ask my doc,.I guess,.but,.ewww,.I don't like asking those questions,.it makes me panic) Have a nice day,.everyone. :)

Posts.Title: Newbie here AzKim cherneski

Posts.Content: AzKim wrote: Hi ladies,..just wanted to say,.I've been reading a lot of the posts here,.especially on days where my mind won't shut off on this BC deal and decided to sign up. It's a relief to see so many ladies doing so well, YEARS after their diagnosis. It gives us all hope. I was 42 at diagnosis,.stage 3. Wow,.what a shocker! I can't even remember what my Doctor said,.except,.I had cancer. I hope I can help other ladies who are newly diagnosed and are freaking out like I did. Soooo many questions about surgery,.chemo,.radiation,.side effects,.etc. I'm happy to say,.I'm cancer free. Finished my last treatment of Herceptin on March 20th of this year. 2 yr survivor! :D Dx 12/27/2007, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 25/28 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2009 03:58PM AzKim wrote: It took me a while for my hair to start falling out,.too. I STILL had hair almost to the end of my treatments,.it wasn't great looking obviously,.but,.I did have a little pony tail for a bit. In the end,.I was bald as a cue ball,..EXCEPT for my legs,.pffft,.what kind of cr*p is that?! I was thinking to myself,..."ok,.I'm gonna lose all my hair,.BUT,.I won't have to shave my legs for 6 months!..yes!"....umm,.no. That wasn't gonna fall out for nothing!
Posts.Title: My hair is not following out Pure carol1949

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2009 04:19AM AzKim wrote: Good afternnon Ladies,.nice to be here today. :) Ha! Jamie Lee Curtis??..I WISH! lol,.but,.thanks for the compliment! Congrats on the year mark,.Helena! Way to go!...ahhh,.30 would be nice and yes,.a couple of boobs would be great,.least one thing,.nobody knows when we're cold!! @@ Isn't it exciting when your hair starts growing back in? I couldn't wait! Wish it would "speed" it up a bit though,.mine WAS blonde and down the middle of my back,..has your hair color changed? Mine did,.it's light brown? It's soft and straight,.not curly like the docs said could happen,..but,.hell,.it could've come in lime green and I would've been happy,.lol. Here's a question for you gals,..is your surgery area still sore? Mine sure is,.all the way around into my pit,.too. It's been 2 freaking years,.I figured it would've gone away by now. It healed nicely,.but,.inside still smarts a bit. ((huggles))

Posts.Title: 5 years out Annie62 Moissy

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2009 02:00PM AzKim wrote: Deborah,.you are NOT crazy! I think everyone goes through the same feelings at one time or another. The whole time I was doing chemo,..I couldn't WAIT for the day till my last treatment,.until that day came and I was freakiung out,.too. I even asked for another year of Herceptin,.but,.my onc said,.no,.I didn't need it. Here it's almost 7 months after my last treatment and I still freak once in a while wondering if this sh*t is sneaking back in somewhere. I didn't feel "safe" ending treatments but,.it is getting a little easier each day. I wish we could get a hand written guarantee!!! I'd like to know if the neuropathy ever goes away,..I still have it and my friggin toe nail is still messed up and hurts from the Taxol, in the mornings,.I feel like I'm 80 yrs old! I could do without the Lymphedema as well,..only good thing about that is....one arm looks 45 and the swollen one has NO wrinkles! It looks very strange,..I have my mothers arm on one side and some young things arm on the other! Hang in there hun,..it does get better and hopefully these SE's will eventually go away.

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2009 09:08PM AzKim wrote: Hi Shanagirl, I STILL feel like this and it's been 9 months since my last treatment. I've been seen every 3 months and I'll tell ya,..I do good for about a month and half after an onc appt,..the other month and a half,.I'm very nervous,.anticipating my next appt. Will it be good news or bad?,.ugh. This whole "experience" blows! I am getting better though,.I feel great,.wake up every day and thank God I'm still here. I plan on being here till I'm old and wrinkley,..well,.old at least! lol. ' ) ((Hugs))
